Reviews.Title: “This place is disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: stephanie b
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place like the plague! We found about 100 small, black ants all over our room. When we brought this to the attention of the manager we were told that we brought the ants with us and they refused to help us. We were not comped and charged the whole $75. The staff is rude, unhelpful and the rooms are disgusting. There were ants carrying food around and we had not even eaten in the room!!! Worst experience EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Yvette K
Reviews.Content: The room I was given was excellent. It was spacious, clean and comfortable with good amenities. The bathroom was very good. The reception service was helpful and friendly which was important as I was a newcomer. The WiFi service was good. The staff were super-nice, had a chat with you and helped you with anything that you needed. I had to cancel early and Jonathon (staff member) was wonderful in helping me with that. I wished I could have stayed longer as the room was so good and the service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, A little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Dan717
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little older, but still clean. They offer coffee and some pastries in the morning. Its about a 5 min walk to the bus which takes about 15 min to get into the city. I had a bicycle with me and made the bike ride from the hotel towards the city which took about 20 or so minutes. If you don't mind taking the bus into the city its a great hotel for the price, if you want to be right in the city I wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ok on a budget”
Reviews.Author: LosReyes
Reviews.Content: I had read some good things and some scary things about this place. Upon our arrival, we noted there was a vacant hotel across the street. Itwas covered in graffiti. We had some concerns whether our car would be safe. The guy working the front desk was freindly and helpful. He was quick with our reservations and had good knowledge of the area. The room we had was clean but smelled a little funky. Lucky it was a nice day and we could open up the windows and let it air out. After that it was tolerable. The location was close to bus stops and not far the the Fremont district. You could walk there but be advised, the walk back is uphill. If I find myself in Seattle again and need a cheap place to stay, since no one tagged my car, this will do.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost and convenient place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: andrew_cam
Reviews.Content: Older motel, probably from 60s, but great place to stay if you're looking for a friendly and convenient place to stay in Seattle. Easy drive to downtown. Within walking distance of Fremont neighborhood. Easy to get to I-5. All in all a great place to stay if you want to be in the city and very good rates.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a cheap place to...”
Reviews.Author: lzldmb
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a cheap place to stay within Seattle city limits, this should be on your list. It is a bridge away from downtown Seattle and the universities so while travel time to all the fun things in Seattle is short, you do need to contend with the city's crazy streets. It's located on WA-99 so easy access to the 5 and 405. Plenty of free parking and coffee till 11 so yay for those things. Again, cheap place in Seattle and this should be on your list.

Reviews.Title: “Run away fast from this one boys and girls”
Reviews.Author: CurtKemp
Reviews.Content: I searched this one on Trip Advisor and gave it a shot. Bad decision. We pulled in late, after 11. Parked, unloaded and went to bed. Room was very old looking but tidy enough. A strange smell which we never did identify punctuated our stay. I got up early, as i usually do, and went out for a walk to find a coffee and just scout around a bit. Wow. Across the street, almost like a bad movie; very run down motel, old white rag top Caddy in the lot with two other old Caddies parked as well. Two very obvious street walkers were out selling what their momma gave them and a guy came out of one of the rooms and yelled, and I quote", Get your a#$ back in here right now B*&^h!". This was 30 seconds into my walk. I was solicited twice in my short, unsuccessful walk to find a coffee, one for sex, the other a soft attempt to try and rob me. I walked back and booked the Space Needle Travellodge for almost the same price at 730 am; when I told them where I was, the lady said," OMG, get out of there, we will find you something immediately". Run, don't walk away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed ... a clean place to stay and cheap.”
Reviews.Author: AFischer72
Reviews.Content: We were coming to Seattle for a show in Fremont at the Nectar (the Skatalites .. it was awesome!!!) We needed cheap place to stay but that wasn't going to be horribly scary which most motels on Aurora are. Most places charge by the hour. I had read some good reviews from posters on TA so I took a chance. The man who took our reservation, well, english was not his first language and he INSISTED that we check in first. I understand, it's Aurora Blvd. You want to see the people that are staying at your establishment. When we checked it another man (night manager) was there. He was super nice. The room was by the main office, that made me feel better but ... it is AURORA. The room was decent. The shower was a bit sketchy but after a night of dancing, I didn't really care, I needed a shower. If I see another show at the Nectar, I will definitely stay at the Marco Polo. On a side note, I love the neon sign!! Classic.

Reviews.Title: “Best In imediate area!”
Reviews.Author: tradeshowworker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of 2 suites first. Was clean, and nice with frig, micro, and couch for $75 plus tax a night. The next time we came they were black topping the parking lot so we stayed at a couple other places in the immediate area. There are some really SCARY, cheaper places on Hwy 99. We were delighted when we could get in the parking lot again!!! This time we got a regular room at a weekly rate of $350 plus tax. It was just as clean, one bed. table w/ chairs, frig, micro, wifi, HBO. The difference from the other "cheap" motels is only a few dollars but they treat you like a guest, not afraid to leave your clothes etc. in room, nothing is missing from rooms such as garbage cans, toilet paper holders, door or window knobs/locks, and the towels are thicker than rags. This is the place we'll come when working in Seattle from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover value motel minutes from downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: DG23
Reviews.Content: Stayed there July 18th, a Friday night. The rooms were clean. The decor was spare, as you'd expect for a stopover motel. Had no problems with any noise from any neighbors. Traffic noise was muffled as soon as the doors and windows were closed. The resident hotel manager was particularly helpful. We really liked him. The parking is easy. The buses into downtown and the Space Needle run right by the motel. You have to walk over a bridge and down about 4 blocks, but they're every 15 minutes. The only thing we actually noticed not up to snuff was that the towels were a little threadbare. All and all, this is great stopover value for a motel that is so close to downtown. You can leave your car there all day and take the bus instead of paying 20/day parking downtown.

Reviews.Title: “refund and left”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix1414
Reviews.Content: We stopped in, secured a room, went to the room then re-evaluated and decided to leave. It wasn't very impressive. Signs warning people against using drugs on property and no parties after 11pm. It just didn't seem safe or clean to us at all. The rooms were marred and worn out. They refunded the credit card easily so I appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “had to wear my flip flops in the shower”
Reviews.Author: ou8it
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews, cheap and clean, everyone said they were clean... Our room stank like a cheap hotel, the sheets looked clean but there were someone else's pubic hairs in the shower. I bought some incense to cover up the smell and never took my shoes off while in the room or shower. It was close to where we were going but I would never stay there again. They were friendly but our room also only had one towel in it, they did get us another when we asked. Not sure when the last time someone really cleaned the place, sure it had been a while. I'm not too picky when traveling on a budget just like to have a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “old but clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: roland65
Reviews.Content: It is an older property that shows wear but is clean. We got a room with 2 queen beds and mini-refrigerator for the price of a Motel 6. It is very convenient, about 10 minutes, to the center city - museum, monorail, space needle. It's just south of Green park which is a great place for outdoor activities and families. Further north on Aurora is the bad area, but this owner is very strict. It was as quiet as could be expected since it is on a main road. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: mikesc
Reviews.Content: It is not a five star hotel, but is a good choice for budget minded travelers. Staff were friendly and rooms were clean. Bathrooms were clean but their towels need replacing; they are fresh, clean, and white, but not very soft. Walking distance to Woodland Park Zoo and a 10 minute drive to downtown attractions. Again a good value for 50 - 60 dollars/night. Will stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Marco Polo Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 4114 Aurora Ave. N, Seattle, WA 98103
